subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] why  'why'?
msgSnippet: ... What happens if there are a lot of minimal pairs in a language, but they happened to be all homophones--are they still considered minimal pairs? Maybe this
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> Paul Tremblay scripsit:
>
> > I pronounce these words exactly the same, as I believe most English
> > speakers do. So while they represent a minimal pair for some speakers,
> > for most they are homophones--at least that is my understanding.
>
> The question is not whether they are homophones, but how many homophones
> there may be. I find these: whale/wail, wheel/weal, when/wen,
> where/wear, whet/wet, whew/woo, whey/way, while/wile, whine/wine,
> whist/wist (archaic), whit/wit, white/wight, whither/wither, why/wye,
> and their compounds. There may be more.

What happens if there are a lot of minimal pairs in a language, but they
happened to be all homophones--are they still considered minimal pairs?
Maybe this would never the case with English, but I understand that
Chinese consists of a huge number of homophones, which the writing
system distinguishes.

In other words, what if in 500 years we still have the same writing
system, but no single English speaker pronounces the /h/ in whale--we
couldn't consider them minimal pairs, could we?

But, now as I write this, I see your point. Even if 50 million English
speakers do pronounce whale and wail differently, there simply aren't
enough words to justify making each one a phoneme, and since QS is based
on phonemes, we shouldn't have separate letters (or so the original post
wonders).


>
> That's not much of a distinction to erect a phonemic split on.
>
> > > Now if someone can prove there are no /h/ -- /N/
> > > minimal pairs...
> >
> > Did you mean /n/ --/N/?
>
> No, it's a very old joke. Because /h/ appears only at the beginning of
> a syllable and /N/ only at the end, there are no actual minimal pairs
> distinguishing them, so they could technically be considered a single
> English phoneme.
>

Yea, now I get it! Someone wrote me off line explaining. Any Noam
Chimksey jokes?

Paul
